KH.content: Egyptian priest in Timeaus assigns “places” to race of men for conservation of archives, writing, tradition > temperate zones [Rousseau in OG] which protect against hot/cold
KH.linkedContent: Egyptian priest in Timeaus assigns “places” to race of men for conservation of archives, writing, tradition > temperate zones [Rousseau in OG] which protect against hot/cold

GOD.content: secret letter becomes literature [Kafka] when it risks publicity, destinerrance, an archive to be inherited, when abandoned to its undecidability (is it the signature of father or son?)
GOD.linkedContent: secret letter becomes literature [Kafka] when it risks publicity, destinerrance, an archive to be inherited, when abandoned to its undecidability (is it the signature of father or son?)

GT.content: writing not as the external archive of the gift, but tied to the very act of gift, act in sense of archive & performative operation
GT.linkedContent: writing not as the external archive of the gift, but tied to the very act of gift, act in sense of archive & performative operation

MONL.content: “incarnate archive of a liturgy whose secret no one will betray,” no one else could appropriate, even I, who is in on the secret
MONL.linkedContent: “incarnate archive of a liturgy whose secret no one will betray,” no one else could appropriate, even I, who is in on the secret

FL.content: for Benjamin, text & signature are specters which exhibit & archive their implosion, in ruins, [Derrida now affirms this “stance”] such is status of deconstructive text: cannot escape law it enunciates, ruins & contaminates itself [at once founding/preserving], becomes specter of itself
FL.linkedContent: for Benjamin, text & signature are specters which exhibit & archive their implosion, in ruins, [Derrida now affirms this “stance”] such is status of deconstructive text: cannot escape law it enunciates, ruins & contaminates itself [at once founding/preserving], becomes specter of itself

OOG.content: phenomenological Reaktivierung: must be fully responsible and conscious of sedimented sense I take up
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenological Reaktivierung: must be fully responsible and conscious of sedimented sense I take up

OOG.content: via Husserl, because senses deposited, stratified, also prescribed by an archi-tectonics, there’s a danger of passivity
OOG.linkedContent: via Husserl, because senses deposited, stratified, also prescribed by an archi-tectonics, there’s a danger of passivity

AF.content: arkhē: commencement, commandment > 2 principles in one, having place, taking place of authority, command, nomological principle
AF.linkedContent: arkhē: commencement, commandment > 2 principles in one, having place, taking place of authority, command, nomological principle

AF.content: arkheion, house of commanders, guardians, of archons, whose documents speak the law
AF.linkedContent: arkheion, house of commanders, guardians, of archons, whose documents speak the law

AF.content: archives take place in a house arrest
AF.linkedContent: archives take place in a house arrest

AF.content: documents in archive inhabit rare place, place of election, law & singularity intersect in privilege
AF.linkedContent: documents in archive inhabit rare place, place of election, law & singularity intersect in privilege

AF.content: shouldn’t be heterogeneity or secret in archive; archontic principle: gathering together of signs
AF.linkedContent: shouldn’t be heterogeneity or secret in archive; archontic principle: gathering together of signs

AF.content: the secret menaces the archive
AF.linkedContent: the secret menaces the archive

AF.content: democracy provides more access to archive [see p. 95 w/ dead father, brothers share archive]
AF.linkedContent: democracy provides more access to archive [see p. 95 w/ dead father, brothers share archive]

AF.content: archival violence: exergue, capitalize on ellipse, accumulates capital in advance, anticipates so to institute (Gewalt)
AF.linkedContent: archival violence: exergue, capitalize on ellipse, accumulates capital in advance, anticipates so to institute (Gewalt)

AF.content: archive at once institutive & conservative [see FL], revolutionary & traditional, an eco-nomic archive: keeps, puts in reserve, saves, but in unnatural fashion (forcing obedience to law)
AF.linkedContent: archive at once institutive & conservative [see FL], revolutionary & traditional, an eco-nomic archive: keeps, puts in reserve, saves, but in unnatural fashion (forcing obedience to law)

AF.content: question of the archive: where does the archive commence?
AF.linkedContent: question of the archive: where does the archive commence?

AF.content: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence
AF.linkedContent: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence

AF.content: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin)
AF.linkedContent: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin)

AF.content: death drive is anarchivic, archiviolithic
AF.linkedContent: death drive is anarchivic, archiviolithic

AF.content: archive takes place at structural breakdown of memory, anamnesis (alive, internal, spontaneous) > archive is hypomnesic [hypomnēma] [pharmakon]
AF.linkedContent: archive takes place at structural breakdown of memory, anamnesis (alive, internal, spontaneous) > archive is hypomnesic [hypomnēma] [pharmakon]

AF.content: no archive w/out outside, w/out technique of repetition
AF.linkedContent: no archive w/out outside, w/out technique of repetition

AF.content: archive requires repetition, repetition permits memory but is indissociable from death drive—so archive introduces forgetfulness, archiviolithic, always works against itself [auto-immunity]
AF.linkedContent: archive requires repetition, repetition permits memory but is indissociable from death drive—so archive introduces forgetfulness, archiviolithic, always works against itself [auto-immunity]

AF.content: death drive destroys archive, unless it can be made up as idol, represented, painted, erotic simulacrum
AF.linkedContent: death drive destroys archive, unless it can be made up as idol, represented, painted, erotic simulacrum

AF.content: death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory
AF.linkedContent: death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory

AF.content: is circumcision an exterior mark? is it an archive?
AF.linkedContent: is circumcision an exterior mark? is it an archive?

AF.content: Jew (or Devil, radical evil, all which is irreconcilable to God in “Christian science”) can be reinvested as an economistic resource of an archive that capitalizes everything [Sagi]
AF.linkedContent: Jew (or Devil, radical evil, all which is irreconcilable to God in “Christian science”) can be reinvested as an economistic resource of an archive that capitalizes everything [Sagi]

AF.content: devil can justify, such is destination of Jew in Aryan ideal
AF.linkedContent: devil can justify, such is destination of Jew in Aryan ideal

AF.content: the prosthetic, hypomnesic techniques of archive not only place for storing, but also determine structure of the archivable content in its very coming into existence, in its relationship to the future
AF.linkedContent: the prosthetic, hypomnesic techniques of archive not only place for storing, but also determine structure of the archivable content in its very coming into existence, in its relationship to the future

AF.content: archival technique: command that which in past instituted/constituted anticipation of the future
AF.linkedContent: archival technique: command that which in past instituted/constituted anticipation of the future

AF.content: no archive drive w/out radical finitude, possibility of forgetfulness, death drive’s threat is infinite, radical evil & political-ethical questions
AF.linkedContent: no archive drive w/out radical finitude, possibility of forgetfulness, death drive’s threat is infinite, radical evil & political-ethical questions

AF.content: lawmakers w/out which one can’t have archives, conservation (memory) puts into reserve (“store”), accumulates, capitalizes, stocks a quasi-infinity of layers (hypermnesic, hypomnesic epidermises of books & penises)
AF.linkedContent: lawmakers w/out which one can’t have archives, conservation (memory) puts into reserve (“store”), accumulates, capitalizes, stocks a quasi-infinity of layers (hypermnesic, hypomnesic epidermises of books & penises)

AF.content: entire economy of archival law found in these 2 words: memorial & reminder
AF.linkedContent: entire economy of archival law found in these 2 words: memorial & reminder

AF.content: arca: cupboard, coffin, prison cell
AF.linkedContent: arca: cupboard, coffin, prison cell

AF.content: the proper of the archive, its instant—certain hypomnesic, prosthetic experience of technical substrate [Derrida had this thought while tinkling on his Macintosh computer]
AF.linkedContent: the proper of the archive, its instant—certain hypomnesic, prosthetic experience of technical substrate [Derrida had this thought while tinkling on his Macintosh computer]

AF.content: can one imagine an archive w/out foundation, w/out substance, w/out subjectile?
AF.linkedContent: can one imagine an archive w/out foundation, w/out substance, w/out subjectile?

AF.content: minimal archive: copy of an impression
AF.linkedContent: minimal archive: copy of an impression

AF.content: to not take account of the Freudian impression [resistance], one confirms, countersigns (archives) his theory of “repression”
AF.linkedContent: to not take account of the Freudian impression [resistance], one confirms, countersigns (archives) his theory of “repression”

AF.content: archivology (interdisciplinary science of archive) risks being paralyzed in preliminary aporia: 1) treat psychoanalysis as general science of the archive 2) place itself under the critical authority of psychoanalysis (disputing it while integrating its logic)
AF.linkedContent: archivology (interdisciplinary science of archive) risks being paralyzed in preliminary aporia: 1) treat psychoanalysis as general science of the archive 2) place itself under the critical authority of psychoanalysis (disputing it while integrating its logic)

AF.content: w/out transgenerational memory (2 types: ancestral or biological), there would be no question of memory or archive
AF.linkedContent: w/out transgenerational memory (2 types: ancestral or biological), there would be no question of memory or archive

AF.content: to know what archive means, we will only know in time to come: question of the future itself, of a response, promise, a responsibility for tomorrow (spectral messianicity at work in archive)
AF.linkedContent: to know what archive means, we will only know in time to come: question of the future itself, of a response, promise, a responsibility for tomorrow (spectral messianicity at work in archive)

AF.content: classically—science, philosophy, intrinsically independent of the singular archive of its history
AF.linkedContent: classically—science, philosophy, intrinsically independent of the singular archive of its history

AF.content: via Yerushalmi, but w/ a Jewish science, archive becomes a founding moment for science as such
AF.linkedContent: via Yerushalmi, but w/ a Jewish science, archive becomes a founding moment for science as such

AF.content: first archivist—God?
AF.linkedContent: first archivist—God?

AF.content: key as seal of arkheion, “deferred obedience”
AF.linkedContent: key as seal of arkheion, “deferred obedience”

AF.content: question of the archive introduced by very stakes of vertiginous difference btwn [Freud’s] “material truth” & “historical truth” [Derrida also mentions Augustine’s “making truth”]
AF.linkedContent: question of the archive introduced by very stakes of vertiginous difference btwn [Freud’s] “material truth” & “historical truth” [Derrida also mentions Augustine’s “making truth”]

AF.content: if Yerushalmi believes that archivization & repression [re: killing of Moses] are irreducible, Derrida insists we can archive what we repress, that repression is archivization, that we can  archive otherwise [animals can sign themselves as hidden]
AF.linkedContent: if Yerushalmi believes that archivization & repression [re: killing of Moses] are irreducible, Derrida insists we can archive what we repress, that repression is archivization, that we can archive otherwise [animals can sign themselves as hidden]

AF.content: repression dissimulates or encrypts the archives, archive of the virtual > virtuality removed from its oppositional coupling to actuality, effectivity, reality [re: full & effective actuality of an archived event]
AF.linkedContent: repression dissimulates or encrypts the archives, archive of the virtual > virtuality removed from its oppositional coupling to actuality, effectivity, reality [re: full & effective actuality of an archived event]

AF.content: no meta-archive
AF.linkedContent: no meta-archive

AF.content: one cannot objectivize the archive [call on its names, employ it, make it gain in auctoritas] w/out remainder, archive produces more archive, never closed, opens to the future
AF.linkedContent: one cannot objectivize the archive [call on its names, employ it, make it gain in auctoritas] w/out remainder, archive produces more archive, never closed, opens to the future

AF.content: no history or archive of the future to come [respect the future to come of the future to come]
AF.linkedContent: no history or archive of the future to come [respect the future to come of the future to come]

AF.content: “if it is at all knowable,” an epochal suspension as energy of virtuality (energeia of a dynamis) [Agamben, Aristotle?], vertiginous, gives only condition of a future which remains to-come, messianic, an archive w/ no record of presence of what is or will have been “actually present” (distinguished radically from all messianism)
AF.linkedContent: “if it is at all knowable,” an epochal suspension as energy of virtuality (energeia of a dynamis) [Agamben, Aristotle?], vertiginous, gives only condition of a future which remains to-come, messianic, an archive w/ no record of presence of what is or will have been “actually present” (distinguished radically from all messianism)

AF.content: question of revelation (Offenbarung) or revealability (Offenbarkeit): does the event make the archivization possible? or vice versa? besides, the after-the-fact, the trace, Nachträglichkeit, disturbs the logic of the these two theses
AF.linkedContent: question of revelation (Offenbarung) or revealability (Offenbarkeit): does the event make the archivization possible? or vice versa? besides, the after-the-fact, the trace, Nachträglichkeit, disturbs the logic of the these two theses

AF.content: the structure of the archive is spectral [see p. 68]
AF.linkedContent: the structure of the archive is spectral [see p. 68]

AF.content: archive always holds a problem for translation, it is repeatable and idiomatic
AF.linkedContent: archive always holds a problem for translation, it is repeatable and idiomatic

AF.content: desire for archive: homesickness for the archaic place of absolute commencement > en mal d’archive [in need of archive, in archive fever, in death drive]
AF.linkedContent: desire for archive: homesickness for the archaic place of absolute commencement > en mal d’archive [in need of archive, in archive fever, in death drive]

AF.content: divorce of archive and archaeology, close, yet radically incompatible [against Foucault?]
AF.linkedContent: divorce of archive and archaeology, close, yet radically incompatible [against Foucault?]

AF.content: nearly ecstatic instant Freud dreams of [re: Studies on Hysteria]: origin speaking by itself, arkhē appears in the nude, w/out archive, anamnēsis w/out hypomnēsis
AF.linkedContent: nearly ecstatic instant Freud dreams of [re: Studies on Hysteria]: origin speaking by itself, arkhē appears in the nude, w/out archive, anamnēsis w/out hypomnēsis

AF.content: archive made possible by destruction drive as originary finitude and expropriation, also no archive fever or desire w/out in-finite movement of radical destruction
AF.linkedContent: archive made possible by destruction drive as originary finitude and expropriation, also no archive fever or desire w/out in-finite movement of radical destruction

AF.content: archive as history of every concept, all conception
AF.linkedContent: archive as history of every concept, all conception

AF.content: no archive of the secret, by definition, it is the very ash of the archive
AF.linkedContent: no archive of the secret, by definition, it is the very ash of the archive

AF.content: we’ll always wonder what in this mal d’archive did Freud burn, what may have burned of his secret passions, w/out him, w/out name, w/out symptom, w/out knowledge, w/out even an ash
AF.linkedContent: we’ll always wonder what in this mal d’archive did Freud burn, what may have burned of his secret passions, w/out him, w/out name, w/out symptom, w/out knowledge, w/out even an ash

MPM.content: to distinguish Gedächtnis (thinking memory) from Erinnerung (interiorizing memory) de Man marks irreducible link btwn memory & technical dimension of memory (art of writing, hypomnesic, exteriority of Mnemon, archivation, data banks, artificial memory) > no deconstruction w/out calling into question dissociation of thought and technology, no longer able to subscribe to Heidegger’s Die Wissenschaft denkt nicht (science does not think)
MPM.linkedContent: to distinguish Gedächtnis (thinking memory) from Erinnerung (interiorizing memory) de Man marks irreducible link btwn memory & technical dimension of memory (art of writing, hypomnesic, exteriority of Mnemon, archivation, data banks, artificial memory) > no deconstruction w/out calling into question dissociation of thought and technology, no longer able to subscribe to Heidegger’s Die Wissenschaft denkt nicht (science does not think)

POOF.content: dominant structures silence others, covering over or destroying the archive > but traditions are never homogenous
POOF.linkedContent: dominant structures silence others, covering over or destroying the archive > but traditions are never homogenous

POOF.content: about to venture on a decision re: omega ω in “O my friends…”, Derrida makes it clear that the guard-rails of a philological coup de théâtre will not efface the archive constructed on an error [p. 225n Agamben helped Derrida w/ all this]
POOF.linkedContent: about to venture on a decision re: omega ω in “O my friends…”, Derrida makes it clear that the guard-rails of a philological coup de théâtre will not efface the archive constructed on an error [p. 225n Agamben helped Derrida w/ all this]

POOF.content: the improbable omega ω has a canonical authority protected by great names, the wager of this mistake, like a capital w/ bottomless surplus-value
POOF.linkedContent: the improbable omega ω has a canonical authority protected by great names, the wager of this mistake, like a capital w/ bottomless surplus-value

POOF.content: jusqu’ici [up until now], for several 1000 years, le temps d'un clin d'œil [the twinkling of an eye], tremors have been registered, archived, by the archons of the same family [phallogocentric fraternization]
POOF.linkedContent: jusqu’ici [up until now], for several 1000 years, le temps d'un clin d'œil [the twinkling of an eye], tremors have been registered, archived, by the archons of the same family [phallogocentric fraternization]

VP.content: the voice simulates the “keeping watch (la garde)” over presence, and that the history of spoken language as archive of this simulation prevents us from considering [its contradiction], prevents us from describing this simulation, the infinite complexity of its structure as phantasm
VP.linkedContent: the voice simulates the “keeping watch (la garde)” over presence, and that the history of spoken language as archive of this simulation prevents us from considering [its contradiction], prevents us from describing this simulation, the infinite complexity of its structure as phantasm

FSW.content: for Freud, wrong to think simple translation can occur from unconscious to conscious, presupposes immobile master text > unconscious consists of archives always already transcriptions
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, wrong to think simple translation can occur from unconscious to conscious, presupposes immobile master text > unconscious consists of archives always already transcriptions

SH.content: ellipsis, discontinuity, caesura, discretion cannot be sublated (aufgehoben) > no dialectic of sense-certainty can reassure the matter of archive’s safekeeping
SH.linkedContent: ellipsis, discontinuity, caesura, discretion cannot be sublated (aufgehoben) > no dialectic of sense-certainty can reassure the matter of archive’s safekeeping

FWT.content: there is no absolute archive, and the trace is not a proof [re: authentic “parent”]
FWT.linkedContent: there is no absolute archive, and the trace is not a proof [re: authentic “parent”]

FWT.content: [re: murder of the father] Freud’s “historical” vs. “material” truth: one based on facts in real archive, the other discernible in symptoms [Yerushalmi neglects the latter]
FWT.linkedContent: [re: murder of the father] Freud’s “historical” vs. “material” truth: one based on facts in real archive, the other discernible in symptoms [Yerushalmi neglects the latter]

ROP.content: future anterior and conditional concerns archivization, what remains or does not remain
ROP.linkedContent: future anterior and conditional concerns archivization, what remains or does not remain

ROP.content: [techno-psychoanalytical] new techniques of archive (tape recorder, etc.), together w/ ideas re: inscription, erasure, blank, memory storage, threaten concept of history > the way in which history is written has not systematically come to terms w/ all this
ROP.linkedContent: [techno-psychoanalytical] new techniques of archive (tape recorder, etc.), together w/ ideas re: inscription, erasure, blank, memory storage, threaten concept of history > the way in which history is written has not systematically come to terms w/ all this

ROP.content: what is getting archived, the trace arriving to efface itself, beyond presence & absence, is impossible to know—not the order of knowledge
ROP.linkedContent: what is getting archived, the trace arriving to efface itself, beyond presence & absence, is impossible to know—not the order of knowledge

ROP.content: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression
ROP.linkedContent: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression

ROP.content: “off the record [in English]” is outside the archive, is there an outside? no, that’s impossible, but that’s deconstruction’s affair
ROP.linkedContent: “off the record [in English]” is outside the archive, is there an outside? no, that’s impossible, but that’s deconstruction’s affair

ATIA.content: autobiography, writing of self as living, trace of the living for itself, auto-affection or auto-infection as memory/archive of living, an immunization, making holy, virginal, indemnify; every autos, ipseity, threatened w/ auto-immunity, the poison of the auto-biography
ATIA.linkedContent: autobiography, writing of self as living, trace of the living for itself, auto-affection or auto-infection as memory/archive of living, an immunization, making holy, virginal, indemnify; every autos, ipseity, threatened w/ auto-immunity, the poison of the auto-biography

WAP.content: institution can forget its own elect (finite memory), its finitude also affects remembrance of what it wants to exclude: the surface of its archive thus inscribed w/ what it refuses, excludes (ex: Walter Benjamin not receiving a degree)
WAP.linkedContent: institution can forget its own elect (finite memory), its finitude also affects remembrance of what it wants to exclude: the surface of its archive thus inscribed w/ what it refuses, excludes (ex: Walter Benjamin not receiving a degree)

DPi.content: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body
DPi.linkedContent: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body

TR.content: French à propos allies necessity & chance, accidental (machinelike) relation to organic, obligatory link; esprit d’à-propos: the art, the genius, the technique of grabbing a chance, making of Khairos or Chaos a significant, archivable, even ineffaceable event
TR.linkedContent: French à propos allies necessity & chance, accidental (machinelike) relation to organic, obligatory link; esprit d’à-propos: the art, the genius, the technique of grabbing a chance, making of Khairos or Chaos a significant, archivable, even ineffaceable event

TR.content: in spite of Rousseau’s avoidance of Augustine, their Confessions come from same tree, same wood, same paper pulp [?] > abyssal problem of conscious/unconscious archivation
TR.linkedContent: in spite of Rousseau’s avoidance of Augustine, their Confessions come from same tree, same wood, same paper pulp [?] > abyssal problem of conscious/unconscious archivation

TR.content: de Man’s “history” not temporal but deals w/ “event,” “power,” which is like Derrida’s always finite (therefore selective) archive
TR.linkedContent: de Man’s “history” not temporal but deals w/ “event,” “power,” which is like Derrida’s always finite (therefore selective) archive

TR.content: destined to virtuality of “sooner or later,” archive produces the event no less than it records, consigns it [archive figures a place & an instance of power]
TR.linkedContent: destined to virtuality of “sooner or later,” archive produces the event no less than it records, consigns it [archive figures a place & an instance of power]

TR.content: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)
TR.linkedContent: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)

TR.content: there is the archived event and the archiving event (as inscription): these can be indissociable, contemporary, but not the same thing (structurally)
TR.linkedContent: there is the archived event and the archiving event (as inscription): these can be indissociable, contemporary, but not the same thing (structurally)

TR.content: no archive w/out body (Derrida prefers “body” to “matter”)

re: mosquito caught mid-bite in amber coffin or 2 midges making love, a jouissance took place whose archive we preserve, archive of a singular event 54 million years ago > archive of man’s confessions a few centuries ago, fractions of second in history of life, earth, & the rest
TR.linkedContent: re: mosquito caught mid-bite in amber coffin or 2 midges making love, a jouissance took place whose archive we preserve, archive of a singular event 54 million years ago > archive of man’s confessions a few centuries ago, fractions of second in history of life, earth, & the rest

TR.content: no true archive of man in his truth before the Confessions
TR.linkedContent: no true archive of man in his truth before the Confessions

TR.content: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive
TR.linkedContent: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive

TR.content: archive is as precarious as it is artificial, it’s threatened in advance > “sooner or later” the worst can happen to it
TR.linkedContent: archive is as precarious as it is artificial, it’s threatened in advance > “sooner or later” the worst can happen to it

TR.content: subjectile, very body of event, archival and auto-deictic body [re: Rousseau’s Confessions]
TR.linkedContent: subjectile, very body of event, archival and auto-deictic body [re: Rousseau’s Confessions]

TR.content: revelation of truth nothing w/out saving body of inscriptions
TR.linkedContent: revelation of truth nothing w/out saving body of inscriptions

C.content: leaving an “act” (act of discursive writing)—in the sense of archive or testamentary document
C.linkedContent: leaving an “act” (act of discursive writing)—in the sense of archive or testamentary document

CF.content: archivization of unforgivable crimes by ‘universal conscience’ better informed than ever: reactivates/accelerates call to forgiveness
CF.linkedContent: archivization of unforgivable crimes by ‘universal conscience’ better informed than ever: reactivates/accelerates call to forgiveness

CF.content: France’s 1964 definition of “imprescriptible” crimes signals toward an ahistorical Final Judgment: crime never effaced from judicial archive [Derrida uses this example to evince an appeal to transcendent order of unconditional in concrete history]
CF.linkedContent: France’s 1964 definition of “imprescriptible” crimes signals toward an ahistorical Final Judgment: crime never effaced from judicial archive [Derrida uses this example to evince an appeal to transcendent order of unconditional in concrete history]

CIN.content: the chance of returning, when one “incenses” a sentence to infinity, adorned w/ all its dead, is more certain than securing sentence in an archive [fire guards better than archive]
CIN.linkedContent: the chance of returning, when one “incenses” a sentence to infinity, adorned w/ all its dead, is more certain than securing sentence in an archive [fire guards better than archive]

BSi.content: events of 9/11: know-how of archive, technical reproducibility part of event (political-economy/power of media) > knowing how to cause fear, making known: virtuality of the worst
BSi.linkedContent: events of 9/11: know-how of archive, technical reproducibility part of event (political-economy/power of media) > knowing how to cause fear, making known: virtuality of the worst

BSi.content: no capital w/out accredited fable > w/ real effects [logic of market part of logic of war]
BSi.linkedContent: no capital w/out accredited fable > w/ real effects [logic of market part of logic of war]

CIR.content: “you archive the system, MacWrite Macintosh SE Apple of PaRDeS” [computer]
CIR.linkedContent: “you archive the system, MacWrite Macintosh SE Apple of PaRDeS” [computer]

EU.content: “current institutions”: university & para-university, publishing, the press, the media, new systems of archiving, etc.
EU.linkedContent: “current institutions”: university & para-university, publishing, the press, the media, new systems of archiving, etc.

EU.content: State or trans-State capitalist powers, re: storage of information in data banks > once library no longer ideal type of archive: university no longer “guardian” or “trustee” of knowledge (this centralizing representation once constituted mission of university itself)
EU.linkedContent: State or trans-State capitalist powers, re: storage of information in data banks > once library no longer ideal type of archive: university no longer “guardian” or “trustee” of knowledge (this centralizing representation once constituted mission of university itself)

EU.content: [vis-à-vis Kant] the “lettered,” die Litteraten (Studirte): businessmen of knowledge, technicians of learning, administrators of archivization, journalists [represent the State, not educated by Faculty of Philosophy]
EU.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Kant] the “lettered,” die Litteraten (Studirte): businessmen of knowledge, technicians of learning, administrators of archivization, journalists [represent the State, not educated by Faculty of Philosophy]

EU.content: to ensure philosophy’s power-to-think-and-judge, Kant draws linear/indivisible border in language (language: that which opens passage to all parasites/simulacrum): [the professor utters only constative], university has no executive power, professor speaks w/out action, does not speak publicly > Kant makes information technology [that which escapes university] philosophy’s most faithful representative—but only as a reserved, intra-university, quasi-private language [before the law of this apparent paradox ultimate responsibility should be taken today]
EU.linkedContent: to ensure philosophy’s power-to-think-and-judge, Kant draws linear/indivisible border in language (language: that which opens passage to all parasites/simulacrum): [the professor utters only constative], university has no executive power, professor speaks w/out action, does not speak publicly > Kant makes information technology [that which escapes university] philosophy’s most faithful representative—but only as a reserved, intra-university, quasi-private language [before the law of this apparent paradox ultimate responsibility should be taken today]

EU.content: fields of publishing, archiving, mediatization have expanded as strikingly as have overcoding & hyper-formalization of language > where does publication begin? [via Kant, publication of knowledge, not knowledge itself, is submitted to authority]
EU.linkedContent: fields of publishing, archiving, mediatization have expanded as strikingly as have overcoding & hyper-formalization of language > where does publication begin? [via Kant, publication of knowledge, not knowledge itself, is submitted to authority]

SPEC.content: demonic in scene of writing/inheritance: en se précédant de son annonce auprès de qui tient lieu prêt pour sa revenue [announcement for those who will hold its place when it comes back] > hope that message will become archival, or indestructible monument of interrupted en-voie

SPEC.content: demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]
